About Log-in Troubles...
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Farm Online Games (Computer): Monster Farm: Online (the original ranching game, no longer available): Miscellaneous Q&A : About Log-in Troubles...
By starbomb178 on Thursday, March 20, 2008 - 07:13 pm:

I cant login to monster farm online... can anyone help me? please...

By SilverTwilight on Thursday, March 20, 2008 - 07:54 pm:

Are you running Easy2Game or VPN? There is an IP ban in place, so that only those accessing the game from a japanese server can play.

After that, you'll need to set your game's resolution one step down from your desktop, and then make sure that your graphics card meets the requirements of the game (listed on the mfo site).

By Lisa Shock on Friday, March 21, 2008 - 09:23 am:

You need to run separate software to mask your IP address and fake the servers into thinking that you are in Japan. You need Easy2Game or VPN running before you start the MF:O software.

By The Letter B on Monday, March 24, 2008 - 07:37 am:

You should have enabled your VPN client adapter which you must've done to see the "network cable is unplugged" message and then you right-click on the VPN icon on the taskbar and go to Start VPN Connection and pick the one you've setup.

By NorseFTX on Monday, April 7, 2008 - 05:50 pm:

I'm not sure what problem you might be having;
I've been using the VPN client (English version) with the settings by TheLetterB posted earlier in this thread, and I've got them working fine.

The fact that the login menu disappears and nothing happens might indicate some problems with video display or something for your computer (what's your CPU RAM? And what's your video card? You can check RAM by right clicking on "My Computer" and choosing "Properties")

By DarkHawk on Saturday, April 19, 2008 - 02:12 pm:

I would like to thank Lisa, LetterB and Spooky first off for showing me how to get onto MFO. It took a little doing, as i havn't played Japanese MMOs before so it was a new networking experiance, but the combined information and suggestions got me online and playing with-in an hour.

By starbomb178 on Saturday, April 19, 2008 - 06:35 pm:

maybe i am just plain unlucky.... all req passed but no game.... I GIVE UP!!! i have been trying to make it work for months!

By DarkHawk on Saturday, April 19, 2008 - 09:18 pm:

Never give up, Never surrender! lol.

Well star, try starting over and double checking all you tools and settings.

First uninstall your current copy of the game.

Regional language uni-codes under your control panel - Regional and Langs. In the advanced tab, make sure it's set to japanese (If not, set it and reset your box)(( may require you to input your Windows disc for language codes))

Don't reinstall MFO until you've checked more stuff.


Then get your VPN Tool up and running properly.
- I am using PacketiX VPN Client Manager Ver. 2
(this is the program that LetterB posted an image of)
- Go with this VPN because we KNOW it works for this.
- With this VPN when you install and load you'll be givin a split screen, the top frame has a "Make new connection" activate that. It may ask you to create a VPN adapter is you don't have one installed, do that.
- Next when creating the connection use the following settings.
- Destination VPN Server box put
Host Name:vpn.mobilefree.jp
Port: 443
Virtual Hub Name: GUEST
- User Authentication setting
Pull down to "Anonymous Authentication"
Username: GUEST
Then finialize your setup.

Now install MFO

Don't forget to try your logon username and password on the MFO website, if they fail their get another account registered.
Thats all i got.
